content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #200

## May 2019 Ballot Comment:

Submitted by Anthony Julian
Chapter/section: Intent Verification Response
Url: https://fhircast.hl7.org/specification/May2019Ballot/index.html
Type: NEG :exclamation: Clarification
In Person requested: Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Summary:

Comment: See note on ANSI modal Verbs

Existing wording: The Hub MUST consider other server response codes (3xx, 4xx, 5xx) to mean that the verification request has failed. If the subscriber returns an HTTP success (2xx) but the content body does not match the hub.challenge parameter, the Hub MUST also consider verification to have failed.
Proposed wording: The Hub SHALL consider other server response codes (3xx, 4xx, 5xx) to mean that the verification request has failed. If the subscriber returns an HTTP success (2xx) but the content body does not match the hub.challenge parameter, the Hub SHALL also consider verification to have failed.

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

hl7-fhircast-bot labeled Issue #200

isaacvetter commented on Issue #200

NOTE on ANSI modal verbs: The usage of ANSI modal verbs consistently provides a vehicle for quickly discerning the conformance criteria.
HL7 adheres to ISO/IEC directive, Appendix G: ANSI modal verbs ("SHALL", "SHOULD", "MAY", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD NOT", "MAY NOT") SHALL be capitalized. See FHIR conformance rules, section 2.1.0.1 "Conformance Language". http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/conformance-rules.html

isaacvetter commented on Issue #200

Use SHALL instead of MUST per HL7 FHIR

wmaethner labeled Issue #200
